tasks.task: Conducting agricultural research at CIMMET's Obregon research station.
subtasks: Observing wheat growth under controlled irrigation.
Comparing wheat yields between zero tillage and traditionally tilled fields.
Simulating various moisture conditions to evaluate wheat stress responses.
Harvesting wheat samples using combine harvesters.
Analyzing grain results to determine yield differences.

tasks.task: Participating in wheat breeding for rain-fed systems.
subtasks: Evaluating genotypes in semi-arid yield trials.
Noting initial observations of wheat stress compensation mechanisms.
Assessing the impact of tillage methods on water-stressed wheat.

tasks.task: Conducting agricultural research on rain-fed wheat systems.
subtasks: Designing trials to compare zero tillage vs. tilled wheat under precision water control.
Managing water application to simulate various moisture stress levels.
Observing wheat growth and stress indicators during the growing season.
Harvesting grain using specialized combine harvesters.
Analyzing grain yield and quality data to determine treatment effects.
Evaluating wheat genotypes for their response to water stress under different tillage practices.

tasks.task: Conducting agricultural research on rain-fed wheat systems
subtasks: Designing trials to compare zero tillage vs. tilled wheat under precision water control
Managing water application for controlled irrigation
Observing wheat growth and noting stress responses during critical stages
Harvesting grain using specialized mini combine harvesters
Analyzing grain yield and quality data to determine treatment outcomes

tasks.task: Participating in wheat breeding for rain-fed systems
subtasks: Managing test plots of wheat varieties in zero tillage and conventional tillage
Evaluating genotypes in semi-arid yield trials (stress tests)
Observing early signs of stress and recording differences in plant development

tasks.task: Testing rain-fed wheat genotypes in international trials
subtasks: Participating in multi-location testing of new wheat lines
Evaluating growth and yield data across various environments (including semi-arid)

tasks.task: Conducting agricultural research on rain-fed wheat systems
subtasks: Designing trials comparing zero tillage vs. conventional tillage
Managing water application for controlled irrigation
Observing wheat growth and noting stress responses during development
Harvesting grain using combine harvesters
Analyzing grain data to compare treatments

tasks.task: Participating in wheat breeding for rain-fed environments
subtasks: Evaluating test plot performance of genotypes under zero tillage and conventional tillage
Noting initial observations of plant stress and growth differences
Assessing the impact of different tillage on stress tolerance

tasks.task: So, overall, the final answer should be those two main tasks with associated subtasks. The output is as structured as possible with MAINTASK followed by list of subtasks (one per line). Start a new MAINTASK with a new task if a new main activity is identified.
Conducting agricultural research at CIMMET's Obregon research station.
subtasks: Observing wheat growth under controlled irrigation.
Comparing wheat yields between zero tillage and normally tilled fields.
Simulating various moisture conditions to evaluate wheat stress responses.
Harvesting wheat samples using combine harvesters.
Analyzing grain results to determine yield differences.

subtasks: Evaluating genotypes in semi-arid yield trials.
Noting initial observations of wheat stress compensation mechanisms.
Assessing the impact of tillage methods on water-stressed wheat.
